title: Masjid has a grave in its garden, (within masjid boundary) can we pray there? #Assim assim al hakeem
transcript: I want to know if it's permissible to pray in the following Majid so there is a grave uh on the garden of the maid uh so for Juma prayer there is a lot of people thousand of people and people pray five m to the Grave also uh during the week uh people can pay to visit the Masjid and woman and non-muslim people can watch us while praying so I want to know is it permissible to pray in this m where is this mik uh in Paris the big magic sorry no it is not permissible to pray in a Masjid where there is a grave within the Masjid borders so if the Masjid was built on the grave meaning the grave was there then they said oh let's commemorate it and build the Masjid this Masjid is prohibited totally to pray in and if the Masjid was there and later on they introduce the grave some Scholars say that it is permissible to pray there but the grave has to be dug out and uh uh buried with the Muslims in the cemetery I personally believe that alhamdulillah we have thousands of mids it's not yeah the last mid on Earth to pray in I would never pray in such a Masjid that has a grave in it to come and pray 5 m away from the Masjid this is totally unacceptable now some would say if the grave itself is in the garden and the building and the structure of the Masjid where people pray in is separated with a wall then this is okay but it is definitely not okay for those in J when the Masjid is fully packed to pray in that area and it's not accepted in Allah Knows Best
